intro: Apetalon, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its lack of petals, giving it the name "apetalon," which translates to "without petals" in Greek. The plant typically has small, greenish or white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette. Apetalon is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats.
